intro: Gaura macrocarpa, commonly known as showy gaura, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Polemoniaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 2 to 4 feet and produces showy, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Gaura macrocarpa is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as butterflies and bees.
